snippet: Those who criticized the Spanish phone company Telefónica’s purchase of control of a Chilean mobile operator in 1992 have long since fallen silent.
Economic reports will include the revised gross domestic product and a home-price index, and companies reporting earnings will include Lowe’s, Staples and Kroger.

headline.main: Looking Ahead to Economic Reports This Week

snippet: Such is the power of the Apple name and brand in China that an enterprising company there has been making one-burner gas stoves with the once-bitten Apple logo and a label that says "iphone."
abstract: Such is the power of the Apple name and brand in China that an enterprising company there has been making one-burner gas stoves with the once-bitten Apple logo and a label that says "iphone."

snippet: Huawei, a Chinese handset maker, is hoping to stake a bigger claim in the smartphone industry with its latest device, a quad-core smartphone called the Ascend D Quad. Richard Yu, the chairman of Huawei Device, unveiled it at a news media event at ...
abstract: Huawei, a Chinese handset maker, is hoping to stake a bigger claim in the smartphone industry with its latest device, a quad-core smartphone called the Ascend D Quad. Richard Yu, the chairman of Huawei Device, unveiled it at a news media event at the Mobile World Congress on Sunday afternoon, boasting that the device had a larger and sharper display than the iPhone 4S.

headline.main: Huawei Takes On Apple and Samsung With the Ascend

snippet: Google came up with "Don't be evil" in 2000, but recently the company, now with $38 billion in revenue, has had to counter complaints that it invaded consumer privacy. Is it possible for a company that has grown big and faces aggressive competitor...
abstract: Google came up with "Don't be evil" in 2000, but recently the company, now with $38 billion in revenue, has had to counter complaints that it invaded consumer privacy. Is it possible for a company that has grown big and faces aggressive competitors to not appear evil?

headline.main: Disruptions: Growing Too Big for a Conscience
headline.print_headline: Disruptions: Growing Too Big For a Conscience

snippet: Sunday marks the start of this year's Mobile World Congress, the annual convention where wireless executives and hardware makers gather to show off their sleekest new devices and discuss the latest trends in the mobile industry.
abstract: Sunday marks the start of this year's Mobile World Congress, the annual convention where wireless executives and hardware makers gather to show off their sleekest new devices and discuss the latest trends in the mobile industry.

headline.main: Mobile World Congress 2012: Talk That Talk

snippet: Apple is estimated to have 52 percent of profits in the smartphone industry, but rivals are making smartphones for much less, threatening its supremacy.
abstract: Apple is estimated to have 52 percent of profits in the smartphone industry, but rivals like Samsung are making smartphones for much less, threatening its supremacy; company has pressure to continue innovating with each new iPhone.

headline.main: Apple’s Lead in Smartphones Is Not Guaranteed

snippet: Such is the power of the Apple name and brand in China that an enterprising company there has been making one-burner gas stoves carrying the once-bitten Apple logo and a label that says "iphone." Stove, cellphone, whatever --- it's the latest exam...
abstract: Such is the power of the Apple name and brand in China that an enterprising company there has been making one-burner gas stoves carrying the once-bitten Apple logo and a label that says "iphone." Stove, cellphone, whatever --- it's the latest example of the Apple fakery industry in China.

snippet: A study of Bell Labs offers a number of lessons about how our country’s technology companies — and our country’s longstanding innovative edge — actually came about.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Jon Gertner describes his study of Bell Labs, recounts some of its major achievements and examines the culture that fostered them; asserts that the research center offers a number of lessons about how technology companies actually came about; suggests that the legacy of Bell Labs is to see that small technological steps should not be mistaken for huge technological leaps.

snippet: Readers respond to an article on domestic first class.
